UI
Class JBattleField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  UI.JBattleField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public final class JBattleField
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener

JBattleField provides both Visual and Logical support for battle operation in the game. It can be considered the most important component of the entire visual part of the Game.

Author:
Ciobanu Alexander
See Also:
Serialized Form

getMapInstance

public int[] getMapInstance()
Returns the map instance used by this Battle Field.

Returns:
Array containing all terrain objects IDs.

                          int iHeight)
Resizes the Battle Field to the newest selected field sizes.

Parameters:
iWidth - New selected Width in Cell Units.
iHeight - New selected Height in Cell Units.

getMapCell

public int getMapCell(int X,
                      int Y)
Returns an item from the map. Note: no bounds checks are performed.

Parameters:
X - The Cell's X coordinate in Cell Units.
Y - The Cell's Y coordinate in Cell Units.
Returns:
Terrain Object ID.

setMapCell

public void setMapCell(int X,
                       int Y,
                       int iID)
Sets an item into the map cell. Note: no bounds checks are performed.

Parameters:
X - The Cell's X coordinate in Cell Units.
Y - The Cell's Y coordinate in Cell Units.
iID - The Cell's Terrain ID number.

cellIsFree

public boolean cellIsFree(int iX,
                          int iY)
Returns true if the given cell doesn't contain anything. It will check if the terrain is proper for a ground unit and also if here is not another object already there.

Parameters:
iX - The Cell's X coordinate in Cell Units.
iY - The Cell's Y coordinate in Cell Units.
Returns:
Check result.
